intro: Mappa borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean map plant, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of dense tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
